sen.j: 道臣命（みちのおみのみこと）は記紀に登場する人物。
sen.e: Michinoomi no mikoto was a figure who appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 記紀→ 統一用語リストにはthe Kojiki (The Record of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)とありましたが、初出なので他の書物同様、"Kojiki " (The Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)としました。
sen.e: Michinoomi no mikoto was a figure who appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
Michinoomi no mikoto was a figure who appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 初名は日臣命（ひのおみのみこと）。
sen.e: His original name was Hinoomi no mikoto.
His original name was Hinoomi no mikoto.
His original name was Hinoomi no mikoto.

sen.j: 天忍日命（あまのおしひのみこと）の後裔。
sen.e: He was the descendent of Amanooshihi no mikoto.
He was the descendent of Amanooshihi no mikoto.
He was the descendent of Amanooshihi no mikoto.
And the ancestor of the Otomo clan.
And he was the ancestor of the Otomo clan.
And he was the ancestor of the Otomo clan.

sen.j: 神武天皇の東征の先鋒を務め、神武天皇即位の際には宮門の警衛を務めた。
sen.e: He took the leadership in the Tosei (Eastern expedition) of Emperor Jinmu and at the enthronement of Emperor Jinmu, he took charge of the security of the Imperial Palace's gates.
He took the leadership in the Tosei (Eastern expedition) of Emperor Jinmu and at the enthronement of Emperor Jinmu, he took charge of the security of the Imperial Palace's gates.
He took the leadership in the Tosei (Eastern expedition) of Emperor Jinmu and at the enthronement of Emperor Jinmu, he took charge of the security of the Imperial Palace's gates.

sen.j: 神武東征において、八咫烏の先導により久米氏を率いて菟田（宇陀）への道を開いた。
sen.e: During the Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu), he opened the way to Uda guided by Yatagarasu (Japanese mythological big crow), leading the troops of the Kume clan
During the Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu), he opened the way to Uda guided by Yatagarasu (Japanese mythological big crow), leading the troops of the Kume clan.
sen.cmt: 文の最後にピリオド追加
sen.e: During the Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of the Emperor Jinmu), he opened the way to Uda guided by Yatagarasu (Japanese mythological big crow), leading the troops of the Kume clan.

sen.j: その功績により神武天皇から名を改めて道臣と名乗るよう言われる。
sen.e: For this achievement, he was recommended by Emperor Jinmu to change the name and called himself 'Michinoomi'.
For this achievement, he was recommended by Emperor Jinmu to change the name and called himself 'Michinoomi.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドを引用符の内側に収容
sen.e: For this achievement, he was recommended by Emperor Jinmu to change the name and called himself 'Michinoomi.'

sen.j: 兄猾（兄宇迦斯、えうかし）が神武天皇に押機（おし）という罠を仕掛けた際、道臣は兄猾に「おまえが作った屋敷には、貴様自身が入れ」と述べ、剣の柄を握り、弓に矢をつがえ追い込み、兄猾は自身の罠に押しつぶされて死んだ。
sen.e: When Eukashi set up a trap called 'Oshi' (crusher) to kill Emperor Jinmu, Michinoomi said to Eukashi, '[y]ou should step in first, now that you yourself made the residence,' and as he forced Eukashi to enter his residence with the trap, gripping the sword by the hilt and fixing the arrow to the bow with the tip of the arrow to him, Eukashi was smashed by his own trap and died.
sen.cmt: 押機（おし）→定訳不明：'Oshi' (crusher)としました。 「おまえが作った屋敷には、貴様自身が入れ」→定訳不明'you should step in first, now that you yourself made the residence' としました。
sen.e: When Eukashi set up a trap called 'Oshi' (crusher) to kill Emperor Jinmu, Michinoomi said to Eukashi, you should step in first, now that you yourself made the residence,' and as he forced Eukashi to enter his residence with the trap, gripping the sword by the hilt and fixing the arrow to the bow with the tip of the arrow to him, Eukashi was smashed by his own trap and died.
sen.cmt: [y]ou should step in first から鍵かっこを削除
sen.e: When Eukashi set up a trap called 'Oshi' (crusher) to kill Emperor Jinmu, Michinoomi said to Eukashi, you should step in first, now that you yourself made the residence,' and as he forced Eukashi to enter his residence with the trap, gripping the sword by the hilt and fixing the arrow to the bow with the tip of the arrow to him, Eukashi was smashed by his own trap and died.

sen.j: 道臣はその死体を切り刻み、その地は宇陀の血原と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Michinoomi cut his body in pieces, and therefore, this site is called bloody field of Uda.
sen.cmt: 宇陀の血原→定訳不明：bloody field of Udaとしました。
sen.e: Michinoomi cut his body into pieces, and therefore, this site is called bloody field of Uda.
sen.cmt: in pieces をinto piecesに変更
sen.e: Michinoomi cut his body into pieces, and therefore, this site is called bloody field of Uda.

sen.j: 国見岳で八十梟帥が討たれた後、天皇の密命によりその残党を討ち取った。
sen.e: After the defeat of Yasotakeru in Mt. Kunimidake, he set out to eradicate the remnants of the defeated Yasotakeru's party by the confidential order of the Emperor.
After the defeat of Yasotakeru in Mt. Kunimidake, he set out to eradicate the remnants of the defeated Yasotakeru's party by the confidential order of the Emperor.
After the defeat of Yasotakeru in Mt. Kunimidake, he set out to eradicate the remnants of the defeated Yasotakeru's party by the confidential order of the Emperor.

sen.j: まず忍坂の邑に大室を造り、精鋭を率いて残党と酒宴を開き、宴も酣になったとき道臣の久米歌を合図に兵たちは剣を抜き、残党を殲滅した。
sen.e: To begin with the operation, he constructed a Omuro (a big hall) in Oshisakano-mura Village, and leading his warfare experts, he held a feast with the remnants, when the party became in full swing, at the Kumeuta music that Michinoomi started to sing, Michinoomi's soldiers drew a sword and destroyed the remnants completely.
sen.cmt: その残党→the remnants of the defeated Yasotakeru's party としました。 天皇の密命→confidential order of the Emperorとしました。
sen.e: To begin with the operation, he constructed an Omuro (a big hall) in Oshisakano-mura Village, and leading his warfare experts, he held a feast with the remnants; when the party became in full swing, to the Kumeuta music that Michinoomi started to sing, Michinoomi's soldiers drew a sword and destroyed the remnants completely.

To begin with the operation, he constructed an Omuro (a big hall) in Oshisakano-mura Village, and leading his warfare experts, he held a feast with the remnants; when the party became in full swing, to the Kumeuta music that Michinoomi started to sing, Michinoomi's soldiers drew a sword and destroyed the remnants completely.

sen.j: その前に、神武天皇自らタカミムスビを顕斎するときにその斎主に任じられ「厳媛（いづひめ）」の号を授けられた（道臣命は男性であるが、女性の名をつけたのは、神を祀るのは女性の役目であったことの名残とみられる）。
sen.e: Sometime before this operation, when Emperor Jinmu was to preside a ritual to serve Takamimusubi as if this god were visible), the Emperor appointed Michinoomi to serve as Saishu (master of religious ceremonies) of the ritual and conferred the name 'Izuhime' (Princess Izu), (although Michinoomi was a man, he was given a female name, probably because there still remained at that time a tradition that it was a female's task to celebrate the god.)
sen.cmt: 顕斎する→serve (a god) (as if this god were visible)としました。 厳媛（いづひめ）→女性の名前だとわかるように、'Izuhime' (Princess Izu)としました。
sen.e: Sometime before this operation, when Emperor Jinmu was to preside at a ritual to serve Takamimusubi as if this god were visible, the Emperor appointed Michinoomi to serve as Saishu (master of religious ceremonies) of the ritual and conferred the name 'Izuhime' (Princess Izu); (although Michinoomi was a man, he was given a female name, probably because there still remained at that time a tradition that it was a female's task to celebrate the god.)
sen.cmt: preside a ritual をpreside at a ritualに変更（presideは自動詞）
sen.e: Sometime before this operation, when Emperor Jinmu was to preside at a ritual to serve Takamimusubi as if this god were visible, the Emperor appointed Michinoomi to serve as Saishu (master of religious ceremonies) of the ritual and conferred the name 'Izuhime' (Princess Izu); (although Michinoomi was a man, he was given a female name, probably because there still remained at that time a tradition that it was a female's task to celebrate the god.)

sen.j: 神武天皇即位後はじめて政務を行う日、道臣命は諷歌（そえうた）・倒語（さかさご）をもって妖気を払った。
sen.e: After Emperor Jinmu's enthronement, on the first day when Emperor Jinmu took the office, Michinoomi sang a piece of Soeuta (waka poem sung to express one's wish in commemorating a certain occasion) and pronounced Sakasago (reverse-spelling) to fend off evil.

After Emperor Jinmu's enthronement, on the first day when Emperor Jinmu took the office, Michinoomi sang a piece of Soeuta (waka poem sung to express one's wish in commemorating a certain occasion) and pronounced Sakasago (reverse-spelling) to fend off evil.

After Emperor Jinmu's enthronement, on the first day when Emperor Jinmu took the office, Michinoomi sang a piece of Soeuta (waka poem sung to express one's wish in commemorating a certain occasion) and pronounced Sakasago (reverse-spelling) to fend off evil.

sen.j: 神武天皇即位の翌年、東征の論幸行賞として築坂邑（橿原市鳥屋町付近）に宅地を賜わり、特に目をかけられたと記されている。
sen.e: It is documented that the next year of Emperor Jinmu's enthronement, he was granted a residential estate in Tsukisakamura (the vicinity of Toriya-machi, Kashihara City), which was as an extremely preferential treatment, as an award based on the evaluation of the merit he achieved during Tosei (the eastern expedition).
sen.cmt: 東征の論幸行賞→定訳不明：the evaluation of the merit he achieved during the Tosei (the eastern expedition)としました。
sen.e: It is documented that the next year of Emperor Jinmu's enthronement, he was granted a residential estate in Tsukisakamura (the vicinity of Toriya-machi, Kashihara City), which was an extremely preferential treatment, as an award based on the evaluation of the merit he had achieved during Tosei (the eastern expedition).
sen.cmt: which was as an extremely preferential treatment からasを削除。achievedの前にhadを挿入（時制の調整）
sen.e: It is documented that the next year of Emperor Jinmu's enthronement, he was granted a residential estate in Tsukisakamura (the vicinity of Toriya-machi, Kashihara City), which was an extremely preferential treatment, as an award based on the evaluation of the merit he had achieved during Tosei (the eastern expedition).
